title: Father Alejandro Solalinde is a inspirational migrant rights advocate and has sheltered many as they...

attachments.displayName: Father Solalinde in Ciudad Ixtepec police station with eighteen Guatemalan migrants, Mexico, 10 January 2007.He was arrested for helping the migrants track down their relatives who had been kidnapped by the side of the train tracks hours earlier.  Father Alejandro Solalinde Guerraâ€™s shelter in the town of Ciudad Ixtepec, Oaxaca state, provides a welcome rest place for migrants. Father Solalinde and his team of volunteers watch over the migrants and try to keep them safe from the criminal gangs that operate with the protection, and sometimes even active participation, of local authorities. Because of his work defending migrant rights, Father Solalinde has been repeatedly threatened and intimidated by local gangs and authorities. Here Father Solalinde is held in Ciudad Ixtepec police station with eighteen Guatemalan migrants. He was arrested for helping the migrants track down their relatives who had been kidnapped by the side of the train tracks hours earlier.

object.content:
Father Alejandro Solalinde is a inspirational migrant rights advocate and has sheltered many as they travel across Mexico. In doing so he has received numerous death threats and been arrested.
In the following blog he talked to us about his motives and the work that needs to be done. http://bit.ly/1dDZ9xC

annotation:
Citation
It is hard not to feel admiration when talking with Father Alejandro Solalinde. Quietly, he describes his fight for the rights of Central American migrants travelling across Mexico along highly dangerous routes, targeted by exploitative drug cartels. With the help of volunteers, Father Solalinde provides care and safety for these migrants in his shelter in Ciudad Ixtepec, Oaxaca State.For years, he has travelled across the United States, Latin America and Europe to raise awareness of the many problems Central American migrants face in Mexico.
